item.title: Wally Grotophorst on "Using powerpoint and twitter simultaneously"
item.dc:creator: Wally Grotophorst
item.description:
Assume you're a Windows user so you might find one of these "stay on top" window utilities works (pin your twitter client as topmost window) then run your powerpoint slideshow.

http://users.forthnet.gr/pat/efotinis/programs/deskpins.html
or
http://download.cnet.com/Stay-On-Top/3000-2072_4-10430147.html

there are probably others. If you're using a Mac, then something like this works:

http://infinite-labs.net/afloat/

Afloat will even make a translucent skin so you can have the twitter stream running full-screen on top of your presentation--although that might get kinda confusing to your audience.

item.title: Arno Bosse on "Using powerpoint and twitter simultaneously"
item.dc:creator: Arno Bosse
item.description: If you save the PowerPoint to a service like SlideShare (or view it in Google Docs Viewer) you can present it in a custom webpage that has e.g. a reduced size, embedded slide presentation on the left and an embedded Twitter stream on the right. Blogs make use of this all the time with e.g. SlideShare presentation in a post and a Twitter widget in a sidebar. It's a kludge..but it'll work. But if you're going to go down this path you might as well just show a Google Doc presentation in a browser stretched to 4/5 of the your screen's width and your Twitter app taking up the remaining 20%. But then you already knew this :^) Alas, I can't think of a more elegant solution.
